snippet: Overturning the 2013 conviction of a former New York City police officer accused of conspiring to kidnap, kill and eat women, a judge said the case reflected “the Internet age in which we live.”
abstract: Federal Judge Paul G Gardephe in Manhattan orders former New York City police officer Gilberto Valle released on bond, hours after overturning his conviction in plot to kidnap, kill and eat women; says Valle's Internet plotting had been 'fantasy role play' and was not evidence of an actual crime; ruling revives debate over when virtual crime becomes actual crime.
lead_paragraph: Overturning the 2013 conviction of a former New York City police officer accused of conspiring to kidnap, kill and eat women, a judge said the case reflected “the Internet age in which we live.”

headline.main: Ruling in Cannibal Case Revives Debate Over When a Fantasy Crosses a Criminal Line
headline.print_headline: Ruling Revives Debate Over When a Fantasy Crosses a Criminal Line
